📊 Welcome to Our Demo Dashboard!
reports.query:
# Demo Dashboard for TReXII RFS-25-06

Welcome to the interactive demo dashboard for the **TReXII RFS-25-06** capability demonstration. This dashboard visualizes a knowledge graph designed for role-based access control, user persona recognition, and intelligent matchmaking between private-sector innovations and DoD opportunities.

> **Note:** If you make changes to this dashboard (e.g., layout, reports, queries), please **export your dashboard** using the **Export button** in the top-right corner.  
> Changes are stored only in your current browser session and **will be lost** if you clear your cache, use a different browser, or start a new dashboard.

---

## Overview

This dashboard showcases how:

- **User personas** are modeled with roles, regions, and organizational context  
- **Technologies** are matched with training aids and linked to DoD-relevant documents  
- **Access control** is enforced using graph relationships based on role hierarchy  
- **Support entities** (e.g., AFWERX, APEX) are shown by user region  

---

## Objective

Demonstrate a graph-driven system that:

- Matches innovations to SBIR, BAA, CSO, and other DoD mechanisms  
- Enforces fine-grained access rules for sensitive documents  
- Tailors responses based on user role and region  
- Supports local outreach by surfacing nearby resources  

---

## How to Use This Dashboard

You can interact with the **current reports and graph visualizations**, or:

- ✏️ Create your own Cypher queries to explore user access, training aids, or region-based support  
- 📈 Build custom tables and graphs from your queries using Neo4j's visual tools  
- 🔄 Simulate role changes or regional reassignment to test access control logic  
- 🧩 Rearrange and resize dashboard components by dragging and adjusting tiles for a personalized layout  

**Example Query:**  
To see which documents Duy Ho has access to, try:

> MATCH (u:User {name: "Duy Ho"})-[:HAS_ACCESS_TO]->(d:Document)  
> RETURN d.title, d.sensitivity

---
